books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.author: Jane Austen
books.summary: A Regency-era novel of manners in which five women try to adjust to their new neighbor, an eligible gentleman.

books.title: After London
books.author: Richard Jefferies
books.summary: A young man tries to understand his place in the world as he explores a post-apocalyptic England.

books.title: The Autobiography of Benjamin Franklin
books.author: Benjamin Franklin
books.summary: Benjamin Franklin writes about his youth, adventures, and achievements.

books.title: Queen Victoria
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: A sardonic and generally unflattering biography of Victoria Alexandrina, Queen of England.

books.title: Wet Magic
books.author: E. Nesbit
books.summary: A group of children visiting the seaside free a captive mermaid and visit her domain.

books.title: Indiscretions of Archie
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: When Englishman Archie Moffam makes a complaint about his room to the owner of the New York hotel, his life is changed forever.

books.title: Henry VI, Part III
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: Henry VI is overthrown and Edward Plantagenet becomes the new King of England.

books.title: The Princess and the Goblin
books.author: George MacDonald
books.summary: A princess and her young friend valiantly fend off a goblin attack with help from a ghostly relative.

books.title: No Name
books.author: Wilkie Collins
books.summary: After two sisters are unexpectedly and shockingly disinherited, the headstrong younger sister takes increasingly desperate measures to try to wrest back her family’s fortune.

books.title: Melmoth the Wanderer
books.author: Charles Robert Maturin
books.summary: A set of overlapping tales tell the story of a mysterious, malevolent, ageless stranger.

books.title: The Life of Buffalo Bill
books.author: William F. Cody
books.summary: The 1879 autobiography of William F. Cody, more commonly known as Buffalo Bill, detailing his early life in the American West.

books.title: The Bellamy Trial
books.author: Frances Noyes Hart
books.summary: A man and a woman are on trial for the murder of his wife, her friend.

books.title: The Story of My Experiments with Truth
books.author: Mahatma Gandhi
books.summary: Gandhi relates his life experiences from his birth in Gujarat in 1869 through the Indian National Congress of 1915.

books.title: Liberalism
books.author: L. T. Hobhouse
books.summary: An early twentieth century description of the philosophy of liberal socialism.

books.title: Gudrun
books.author: Anonymous
books.summary: A princess is captured by a jealous prince from a rival kingdom.

books.title: The Mercy of Allah
books.author: Hilaire Belloc
books.summary: An entrepreneurial businessman satirically relates to his nephews how he became the wealthiest man in Baghdad.

books.title: Metropolis
books.author: Thea von Harbou
books.summary: In a futuristic dystopian city, the son of the city’s mastermind falls in love with a revolutionary activist.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: E. M. Forster
books.summary: A collection of E. M. Forster’s short stories, ordered by date of their original publication.

books.title: The Path to Rome
books.author: Hilaire Belloc
books.summary: Hilaire Belloc takes a walking pilgrimage to Rome from his hometown in France, writing of the journey, sketching the sights, and digressing on a wide variety of subjects.

books.title: Through the Brazilian Wilderness
books.author: Theodore Roosevelt
books.summary: Theodore Roosevelt’s autobiographical account of his expedition into the uncharted depths of the Brazilian rainforest.
